metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32435 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved state management. This issue is fixed in macOS Ventura 13.3, Safari 16.4, iOS 16.4 and iPadOS 16.4, iOS 15.7.7 and iPadOS 15.7.7. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS released before iOS 15.7.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.40.0-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in mantic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.40.0-3ubuntu1').
